alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:14PM EST until December 20 at 4:16AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut... Yantic River near Yantic affecting New London County. For the Yantic River...including Yantic...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yantic River near Yantic. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding along Otrobando Avenue at the Fitness World, Pleasant Street bridge and along Town Street at the Norwichtown Mall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Monday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM EST Monday was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage overnight and continue falling to 4.0 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet on 04/11/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Yantic River Yantic 9.0 10.8 Mon 7 pm EST 7.1 4.6 MSG &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 815 AM EST.
